verses.textLa: Et ecce palam loquitur, et nihil ei dicunt. Numquid vere cognoverunt principes quia hic est Christus?

verses.textEn: But we know him and where he is from. And when the Christ has arrived, no one will know where he is from.”
verses.textLa: Sed hunc scimus unde sit: Christus autem cum venerit, nemo scit unde sit.

verses.textEn: Therefore, Jesus cried out in the temple, teaching and saying: “You know me, and you also know where I am from. And I have not arrived of myself, but he who sent me is true, and him you do not know.
verses.textLa: Clamabat ergo Iesus in templo docens, et dicens: Et me scitis, et unde sim scitis: et a me ipso non veni, sed est verus, qui misit me, quem vos nescitis.

verses.textEn: I know him. For I am from him, and he has sent me.”
verses.textLa: Ego scio eum: quia ab ipso sum, et ipse me misit.

verses.textEn: Therefore, they were seeking to apprehend him, and yet no one laid hands on him, because his hour had not yet come.
verses.textLa: Quærebant ergo eum apprehendere: et nemo misit in illum manus, quia nondum venerat hora eius.

verses.textEn: But many among the crowd believed in him, and they were saying, “When the Christ arrives, will he perform more signs than this man does?”
verses.textLa: De turba autem multi crediderunt in eum, et dicebant: Christus cum venerit, numquid plura signa faciet quam quæ hic facit?

verses.textEn: The Pharisees heard the crowd murmuring these things about him. And the leaders and the Pharisees sent attendants to apprehend him.
verses.textLa: Audierunt Pharisæi turbam murmurantem de illo hæc: et miserunt principes, et Pharisæi ministros ut apprehenderent eum.

verses.textEn: Therefore, Jesus said to them: “For a brief time, I am still with you, and then I am going to him who sent me.
verses.textLa: Dixit ergo eis Iesus: Adhuc modicum tempus vobiscum sum: et vado ad eum, qui me misit.

verses.textEn: You shall seek me, and you will not find me. And where I am, you are not able to go.”
verses.textLa: Quæretis me, et non invenietis: et ubi ego sum, vos non potestis venire.

verses.textEn: And so the Jews said among themselves: “Where is this place to which he will go, such that we will not find him? Will he go to those dispersed among the Gentiles and teach the Gentiles?
verses.textLa: Dixerunt ergo Iudæi ad semetipsos: Quo hic iturus est, quia non inveniemus eum? Numquid in dispersionem Gentium iturus est, et docturus Gentes?

verses.textEn: What is this word that he spoke, ‘You will seek me and you will not find me; and where I am, you are not able to go?’ ”
verses.textLa: Quis est hic sermo, quem dixit: Quæretis me, et non invenietis: et ubi sum ego, vos non potestis venire?

verses.textEn: Then, on the last great day of the feast, Jesus was standing and crying out, saying: “If anyone thirsts, let him come to me and drink:
verses.textLa: In novissimo autem die magno festivitatis stabat Iesus, et clamabat, dicens: Si quis sitit, veniat ad me, et bibat.

verses.textEn: whoever believes in me, just as Scripture says, ‘From his chest shall flow rivers of living water.’ ”
verses.textLa: Qui credit in me, sicut dicit Scriptura, flumina de ventre eius fluent aquæ vivæ.
verses.notes: The word ‘ventre’ is a general term in Latin used to refer to the inner organs, or the inner parts of the body. It is used metaphorically in many instances. It can be properly translated as ‘belly’ or ‘heart’ or ‘inner self’ or ‘chest.’ In this case, the living waters that flow from Christ’s chest, flow from the wound in his side. This event is a living symbol of the graces that flow from the Sacraments.

verses.textEn: Now he said this about the Spirit, which those who believe in him would soon be receiving. For the Spirit had not yet been given, because Jesus had not yet been glorified.
verses.textLa: Hoc autem dixit de Spiritu, quem accepturi erant credentes in eum: nondum enim erat Spiritus datus, quia Iesus nondum erat glorificatus.

verses.textEn: Therefore, some from that crowd, when they had heard these words of his, were saying, “This one truly is the Prophet.”
verses.textLa: Ex illa ergo turba cum audissent hos sermones eius, dicebant: Hic est vere Propheta.

verses.textEn: Others were saying, “He is the Christ.” Yet certain ones were saying: “Does the Christ come from Galilee?
verses.textLa: Alii dicebant: Hic est Christus. Quidam autem dicebant: Numquid a Galilæa venit Christus?

verses.textEn: Does Scripture not say that the Christ comes from the offspring of David and from Bethlehem, the town where David was?”
verses.textLa: Nonne Scriptura dicit: Quia ex semine David, et de Bethlehem castello, ubi erat David, venit Christus?

verses.textEn: And so there arose a dissension among the multitude because of him.
verses.textLa: Dissensio itaque facta est in turba propter eum.

verses.textEn: Now certain ones among them wanted to apprehend him, but no one laid hands upon him.
verses.textLa: Quidam autem ex ipsis volebant apprehendere eum: sed nemo misit super eum manus.

verses.textEn: Therefore, the attendants went to the high priests and the Pharisees. And they said to them, “Why have you not brought him?”
verses.textLa: Venerunt ergo ministri ad Pontifices, et Pharisæos. Et dixerunt eis illi: Quare non adduxistis illum?
verses.notes: The word ‘Pontifices’ is the plural of ‘Pontifex,’ which means high priest. The word is used in the plural because there was one high priest, plus a former high priest who had been deposed by the Romans. But both wielded authority over the Jews, because the position of high priest was supposed to be for life.

verses.textEn: The attendants responded, “Never has a man spoken like this man.”
verses.textLa: Responderunt ministri: Numquam sic locutus est homo, sicut hic homo.

verses.textEn: And so the Pharisees answered them: “Have you also been seduced?
verses.textLa: Responderunt ergo eis Pharisæi: Numquid et vos seducti estis?

verses.textEn: Have any of the leaders believed in him, or any of the Pharisees?
verses.textLa: Numquid ex principibus aliquis credidit in eum, aut ex Pharisæis?

verses.textEn: But this crowd, which does not know the law, they are accursed.”
verses.textLa: Sed turba hæc, quæ non novit legem, maledicti sunt.

verses.textEn: Nicodemus, the one who came to him by night and who was one of them, said to them,
verses.textLa: Dixit Nicodemus ad eos, ille, qui venit ad eum nocte, qui unus erat ex ipsis:

verses.textEn: “Does our law judge a man, unless it has first heard him and has known what he has done?”
verses.textLa: Numquid lex nostra iudicat hominem, nisi prius audierit ab ipso, et cognoverit quid faciat?

verses.textEn: They responded and said to him: “Are you also a Galilean? Study the Scriptures, and see that a prophet does not arise from Galilee.”
verses.textLa: Responderunt, et dixerunt ei: Numquid et tu Galilæus es? Scrutare Scripturas, et vide quia a Galilæa propheta non surgit.

verses.textEn: And each one returned to his own house.
verses.textLa: Et reversi sunt unusquisque in domum suam.

verses.textEn: But Jesus continued on to the Mount of Olives.
verses.textLa: Iesus autem perrexit in montem Oliveti:

verses.textEn: And early in the morning, he went again to the temple; and all the people came to him. And sitting down, he taught them.
verses.textLa: et diluculo iterum venit in templum, et omnis populus venit ad eum, et sedens docebat eos.

verses.textEn: Now the scribes and Pharisees brought forward a woman caught in adultery, and they stood her in front of them.
verses.textLa: Adducunt autem scribæ, et Pharisæi mulierem in adulterio deprehensam: et statuerunt eam in medio,

verses.textEn: And they said to him: “Teacher, this woman was just now caught in adultery.
verses.textLa: et dixerunt ei: Magister, hæc mulier modo deprehensa est in adulterio.

verses.textEn: And in the law, Moses commanded us to stone such a one. Therefore, what do you say?”
verses.textLa: In lege autem Moyses mandavit nobis huiusmodi lapidare. Tu ergo quid dicis?

verses.textEn: But they were saying this to test him, so that they might be able to accuse him. Then Jesus bent down and wrote with his finger on the earth.
verses.textLa: Hoc autem dicebant tentantes eum, ut possent accusare eum. Iesus autem inclinans se deorsum, digito scribebat in terra.

verses.textEn: And then, when they persevered in questioning him, he stood upright and said to them, “Let whoever is without sin among you be the first to cast a stone at her.”
verses.textLa: Cum ergo perseverarent interrogantes eum, erexit se, et dixit eis: Qui sine peccato est vestrum, primus in illam lapidem mittat.

verses.textEn: And bending down again, he wrote on the earth.
verses.textLa: Et iterum se inclinans, scribebat in terra.
verses.notes: Jesus wrote on the earth with his finger because the ten commandments were written on tablets of stone from the earth with the finger of God. This woman broke one of the ten commandments. Jesus wrote twice on the ground symbolizing the two new commandments, to love God and love neighbor.

verses.textEn: But upon hearing this, they went away, one by one, beginning with the eldest. And Jesus alone remained, with the woman standing in front of him.
verses.textLa: Audientes autem unus post unum exibant, incipientes a senioribus: et remansit solus Iesus, et mulier in medio stans.

verses.textEn: Then Jesus, raising himself up, said to her: “Woman, where are those who accused you? Has no one condemned you?”
verses.textLa: Erigens autem se Iesus, dixit ei: Mulier, ubi sunt, qui te accusabant? Nemo te condemnavit?

verses.textEn: And she said, “No one, Lord.” Then Jesus said: “Neither will I condemn you. Go, and now do not choose to sin anymore.”
verses.textLa: Quæ dixit: Nemo, Domine. Dixit autem Iesus: Nec ego te condemnabo: Vade, et iam amplius noli peccare.

verses.textEn: Then Jesus spoke to them again, saying: “I am the light of the world. Whoever follows me does not walk in darkness, but shall have the light of life.”
verses.textLa: Iterum ergo locutus est eis Iesus, dicens: Ego sum lux mundi: qui sequitur me, non ambulat in tenebris, sed habebit lumen vitæ.

verses.textEn: And so the Pharisees said to him, “You offer testimony about yourself; your testimony is not true.”
verses.textLa: Dixerunt ergo ei Pharisæi: Tu de teipso testimonium perhibes: testimonium tuum non est verum.

verses.textEn: Jesus responded and said to them: “Even though I offer testimony about myself, my testimony is true, for I know where I came from and where I am going.
verses.textLa: Respondit Iesus, et dixit eis: Et si ego testimonium perhibeo de meipso, verum est testimonium meum: quia scio unde veni, et quo vado: vos autem nescitis unde venio, aut quo vado.

verses.textEn: You judge according to the flesh. I do not judge anyone.
verses.textLa: Vos secundum carnem iudicatis: ego non iudico quemquam:

verses.textEn: And when I do judge, my judgment is true. For I am not alone, but it is I and he who sent me: the Father.
verses.textLa: et si iudico ego, iudicium meum verum est, quia solus non sum: sed ego, et qui misit me, Pater.

verses.textEn: And it is written in your law that the testimony of two men is true.
verses.textLa: Et in lege vestra scriptum est, quia duorum hominum testimonium verum est.

verses.textEn: I am one who offers testimony about myself, and the Father who sent me offers testimony about me.”
verses.textLa: Ego sum, qui testimonium perhibeo de me ipso: et testimonium perhibet de me, qui misit me, Pater.

verses.textEn: Therefore, they said to him, “Where is your Father?” Jesus answered: “You know neither me, nor my Father. If you did know me, perhaps you would know my Father also.”
verses.textLa: Dicebant ergo ei: Ubi est Pater tuus? Respondit Iesus: Neque me scitis, neque Patrem meum: si me sciretis, forsitan et Patrem meum sciretis.

verses.textEn: Jesus spoke these words at the treasury, while teaching in the temple. And no one apprehended him, because his hour had not yet come.
verses.textLa: Hæc verba locutus est Iesus in gazophylacio, docens in templo: et nemo apprehendit eum, quia necdum venerat hora eius.

verses.textEn: Therefore, Jesus again spoke to them: “I am going, and you shall seek me. And you will die in your sin. Where I am going, you are not able to go.”
verses.textLa: Dixit ergo iterum eis Iesus: Ego vado, et quæretis me, et in peccato vestro moriemini. Quo ego vado, vos non potestis venire.

verses.textEn: And so the Jews said, “Is he going to kill himself, for he said: ‘Where I am going, you are not able to go?’ ”
verses.textLa: Dicebant ergo Iudæi: Numquid interficiet semetipsum, quia dixit: Quo ego vado, vos non potestis venire?

verses.textEn: And he said to them: “You are from below. I am from above. You are of this world. I am not of this world.
verses.textLa: Et dicebat eis: Vos de deorsum estis, ego de supernis sum. Vos de mundo hoc estis, ego non sum de hoc mundo.

verses.textEn: Therefore, I said to you, that you will die in your sins. For if you will not believe that I am, you will die in your sin.”
verses.textLa: Dixi ergo vobis quia moriemini in peccatis vestris: si enim non credideritis quia ego sum, moriemini in peccato vestro.

verses.textEn: And so they said to him, “Who are you?” Jesus said to them: “The Beginning, who is also speaking to you.
verses.textLa: Dicebant ergo ei: Tu quis es? Dixit eis Iesus: Principium, qui et loquor vobis.

verses.textEn: I have much to say about you and to judge. But he who sent me is true. And what I have heard from him, this I speak within the world.”
verses.textLa: Multa habeo de vobis loqui, et iudicare. Sed qui me misit, verax est: et ego quæ audivi ab eo, hæc loquor in mundo.

verses.textEn: And they did not realize that he was calling God his Father.
verses.textLa: Et non cognoverunt quia Patrem eius dicebat Deum.

verses.textEn: And so Jesus said to them: “When you will have lifted up the Son of man, then you shall realize that I am, and that I do nothing of myself, but just as the Father has taught me, so do I speak.
verses.textLa: Dixit ergo eis Iesus: Cum exaltaveritis Filium hominis, tunc cognoscetis quia ego sum, et a meipso facio nihil, sed sicut docuit me Pater, hæc loquor:

verses.textEn: And he who sent me is with me, and he has not abandoned me alone. For I always do what is pleasing to him.”
verses.textLa: et qui me misit, mecum est, et non reliquit me solum: quia ego quæ placita sunt ei, facio semper.

verses.textEn: As he was speaking these things, many believed in him.
verses.textLa: Hæc illo loquente, multi crediderunt in eum.

verses.textEn: Therefore, Jesus said to those Jews who believed in him: “If you will abide in my word, you will truly be my disciples.
verses.textLa: Dicebat ergo Iesus ad eos, qui crediderunt ei, Iudæos: Si vos manseritis in sermone meo, vere discipuli mei eritis:

verses.textEn: And you shall know the truth, and the truth shall set you free.”
verses.textLa: et cognoscetis veritatem, et veritas liberabit vos.

verses.textEn: They answered him: “We are the offspring of Abraham, and we have never been a slave to anyone. How can you say, ‘You shall be set free?’ ”
verses.textLa: Responderunt ei: Semen Abrahæ sumus, et nemini servivimus umquam: quomodo tu dicis: Liberi eritis?

verses.textEn: Jesus answered them: “Amen, amen, I say to you, that everyone who commits sin is a slave of sin.
verses.textLa: Respondit eis Iesus: Amen, amen dico vobis: quia omnis, qui facit peccatum, servus est peccati.

verses.textEn: Now the slave does not abide in the house for eternity. Yet the Son does abide in eternity.
verses.textLa: Servus autem non manet in domo in æternum: Filius autem manet in æternum.

verses.textEn: Therefore, if the Son has set you free, then you will truly be free.
verses.textLa: Si ergo vos Filius liberaverit, vere liberi eritis.

verses.textEn: I know that you are sons of Abraham. But you are seeking to kill me, because my word has not taken hold in you.
verses.textLa: Scio quia filii Abrahæ estis: sed quæritis me interficere, quia sermo meus non capit in vobis.

verses.textEn: I speak what I have seen with my Father. And you do what you have seen with your father.”
verses.textLa: Ego quod vidi apud Patrem meum, loquor: et vos quæ vidistis apud patrem vestrum, facitis.

verses.textEn: They responded and said to him, “Abraham is our father.” Jesus said to them: “If you are the sons of Abraham, then do the works of Abraham.
verses.textLa: Responderunt, et dixerunt ei: Pater noster Abraham est. Dicit eis Iesus: Si filii Abrahæ estis, opera Abrahæ facite.

verses.textEn: But now you are seeking to kill me, a man who has spoken the truth to you, which I have heard from God. This is not what Abraham did.
verses.textLa: Nunc autem quæritis me interficere, hominem, qui veritatem vobis locutus sum, quam audivi a Deo: hoc Abraham non fecit.

verses.textEn: You do the works of your father.” Therefore, they said to him: “We were not born out of fornication. We have one father: God.”
verses.textLa: Vos facitis opera patris vestri. Dixerunt itaque ei: Nos ex fornicatione non sumus nati: unum patrem habemus Deum.

verses.textEn: Then Jesus said to them: “If God were your father, certainly you would love me. For I proceeded and came from God. For I did not come from myself, but he sent me.
verses.textLa: Dixit ergo eis Iesus: Si Deus pater vester esset: diligeretis utique et me. Ego enim ex Deo processi, et veni: neque enim a me ipso veni, sed ille me misit.

verses.textEn: Why do you not recognize my speech? It is because you are not able to hear my word.
verses.textLa: Quare loquelam meam non cognoscitis? Quia non potestis audire sermonem meum.

verses.textEn: You are of your father, the devil. And you will carry out the desires of your father. He was a murderer from the beginning. And he did not stand in the truth, because the truth is not in him. When he speaks a lie, he speaks it from his own self. For he is a liar, and the father of lies.
verses.textLa: Vos ex patre diabolo estis: et desideria patris vestri vultis facere. Ille homicida erat ab initio, et in veritate non stetit: quia non est veritas in eo: cum loquitur mendacium, ex propriis loquitur, quia mendax est, et pater eius.

verses.textEn: But if I speak the truth, you do not believe me.
verses.textLa: Ego autem si veritatem dico, non creditis mihi.

verses.textEn: Which of you can convict me of sin? If I speak the truth to you, why do you not believe me?
verses.textLa: Quis ex vobis arguet me de peccato? Si veritatem dico vobis, quare non creditis mihi?

verses.textEn: Whoever is of God, hears the words of God. For this reason, you do not hear them: because you are not of God.”
verses.textLa: Qui ex Deo est, verba Dei audit. Propterea vos non auditis, quia ex Deo non estis.

verses.textEn: Therefore, the Jews responded and said to him, “Are we not correct in saying that you are a Samaritan, and that you have a demon?”
verses.textLa: Responderunt ergo Iudæi, et dixerunt ei: Nonne bene dicimus nos quia Samaritanus es tu, et dæmonium habes?

verses.textEn: Jesus responded: “I do not have a demon. But I honor my Father, and you have dishonored me.
verses.textLa: Respondit Iesus: Ego dæmonium non habeo: sed honorifico Patrem meum, et vos inhonorastis me.

verses.textEn: But I am not seeking my own glory. There is One who seeks and judges.
verses.textLa: Ego autem non quæro gloriam meam: est qui quærat, et iudicet.

verses.textEn: Amen, amen, I say to you, if anyone will have kept my word, he will not see death for eternity.”
verses.textLa: Amen, amen dico vobis: si quis sermonem meum servaverit, mortem non videbit in æternum.

verses.textEn: Therefore, the Jews said: “Now we know that you have a demon. Abraham is dead, and the Prophets; and yet you say, ‘If anyone will have kept my word, he shall not taste death for eternity.’
verses.textLa: Dixerunt ergo Iudæi: Nunc cognovimus quia dæmonium habes. Abraham mortuus est, et Prophetæ: et tu dicis: Si quis sermonem meum servaverit, non gustabit mortem in æternum.

verses.textEn: Are you greater than our father Abraham, who is dead? And the prophets are dead. So who do you make yourself to be?”
verses.textLa: Numquid tu maior es patre nostro Abraham, qui mortuus est? et Prophetæ mortui sunt. Quem te ipsum facis?

verses.textEn: Jesus responded: “If I glorify myself, my glory is nothing. It is my Father who glorifies me. And you say about him that he is your God.
verses.textLa: Respondit Iesus: Si ego glorifico me ipsum, gloria mea nihil est: est Pater meus, qui glorificat me, quem vos dicitis quia Deus vester est.

verses.textEn: And yet you have not known him. But I know him. And if I were to say that I do not know him, then I would be like you, a liar. But I know him, and I keep his word.
verses.textLa: Et non cognovistis eum: ego autem novi eum: Et si dixero quia non scio eum, ero similis vobis, mendax. Sed scio eum, et sermonem eius servo.

verses.textEn: Abraham, your father, rejoiced that he might see my day; he saw it and was glad.”
verses.textLa: Abraham pater vester exultavit ut videret diem meum: vidit, et gavisus est.

verses.textEn: And so the Jews said to him, “You have not yet reached fifty years, and you have seen Abraham?”
verses.textLa: Dixerunt ergo Iudæi ad eum: Quinquaginta annos nondum habes, et Abraham vidisti?

verses.textEn: Jesus said to them, “Amen, amen, I say to you, before Abraham was made, I am.”
verses.textLa: Dixit eis Iesus: Amen, amen dico vobis, antequam Abraham fieret, ego sum.

verses.textEn: Therefore, they took up stones to cast at him. But Jesus hid himself, and he departed from the temple.
verses.textLa: Tulerunt ergo lapides, ut iacerent in eum: Iesus autem abscondit se, et exivit de templo.

verses.textEn: And Jesus, while passing by, saw a man blind from birth.
verses.textLa: Et præteriens Iesus vidit hominem cæcum a nativitate:

verses.textEn: And his disciples asked him, “Rabbi, who sinned, this man or his parents, that he would be born blind?”
verses.textLa: et interrogaverunt eum discipuli eius: Rabbi, quis peccavit, hic, aut parentes eius, ut cæcus nasceretur?

verses.textEn: Jesus responded: “Neither this man nor his parents sinned, but it was so that the works of God would be made manifest in him.
verses.textLa: Respondit Iesus: Neque hic peccavit, neque parentes eius: sed ut manifestentur opera Dei in illo.

verses.textEn: I must work the works of him who sent me, while it is day: the night is coming, when no one is able to work.
verses.textLa: Me oportet operari opera eius, qui misit me, donec dies est: venit nox, quando nemo potest operari.

verses.textEn: As long as I am in the world, I am the light of the world.”
verses.textLa: Quamdiu sum in mundo, lux sum mundi.

verses.textEn: When he had said these things, he spat on the ground, and he made clay from the spittle, and he smeared the clay over his eyes.
verses.textLa: Hæc cum dixisset, expuit in terram, et fecit lutum ex sputo, et linivit lutum super oculos eius,

verses.textEn: And he said to him: “Go, wash in the pool of Siloam” (which is translated as: one who has been sent). Therefore, he went away and washed, and he returned, seeing.
verses.textLa: et dixit ei: Vade, lava in natatoria Siloe (quod interpretatur Missus.) Abiit ergo, et lavit, et venit videns.

verses.textEn: And so the bystanders and those who had seen him before, when he was a beggar, said, “Is this not the one who was sitting and begging?” Some said, “This is he.”
verses.textLa: Itaque vicini, et qui viderant eum prius quia mendicus erat, dicebant: Nonne hic est, qui sedebat, et mendicabat? Alii dicebant: Quia hic est.
verses.notes: In this context, ‘vicini’ is not ‘neighbors’ but ‘those standing near,’ or ‘bystanders.’

verses.textEn: But others said, “Certainly not, but he is similar to him.” Yet truly, he himself said, “I am he.”
verses.textLa: Alii autem: Nequaquam, sed similis est ei. Ille vero dicebat: Quia ego sum.

verses.textEn: Therefore, they said to him, “How were your eyes opened?”
verses.textLa: Dicebant ergo ei: Quomodo aperti sunt tibi oculi?

verses.textEn: He responded: “That man who is called Jesus made clay, and he anointed my eyes and said to me, ‘Go to the pool of Siloam and wash.’ And I went, and I washed, and I see.”
verses.textLa: Respondit: Ille homo, qui dicitur Iesus, lutum fecit: et unxit oculos meos, et dixit mihi: Vade ad natatoria Siloe, et lava. Et abii, et lavi, et video.
verses.notes: The phrasing of this last part, ‘Et abii, et lavi, et video,’ sounds as if it might have been originally spoken in Latin. Perhaps this man spoke Latin, rather than the more common Aramaic. As a blind man, he would have been considered to be blind as a punishment for sin, and would therefore be excluded from being taught by the Jewish priests. So he would not have learned much Hebrew. Being excluded, to some extent, from Jewish society, he may have favored Latin as his spoken language. His other quoted words also sound very natural in Latin.

verses.textEn: And they said to him, “Where is he?” He said, “I do not know.”
verses.textLa: Et dixerunt ei: Ubi est ille? Ait: Nescio.

verses.textEn: They brought the one who had been blind to the Pharisees.
verses.textLa: Adducunt eum ad Pharisæos, qui cæcus fuerat.

verses.textEn: Now it was the Sabbath, when Jesus made the clay and opened his eyes.
verses.textLa: Erat autem Sabbatum quando lutum fecit Iesus, et aperuit oculos eius.

verses.textEn: Therefore, again the Pharisees questioned him as to how he had seen. And he said to them, “He placed clay over my eyes, and I washed, and I see.”
verses.textLa: Iterum ergo interrogabant eum Pharisæi quomodo vidisset. Ille autem dixit eis: Lutum mihi posuit super oculos, et lavi, et video.

verses.textEn: And so certain Pharisees said: “This man, who does not keep the Sabbath, is not from God.” But others said, “How could a sinful man accomplish these signs?” And there was a schism among them.
verses.textLa: Dicebant ergo ex Pharisæis quidam: Non est hic homo a Deo, qui Sabbatum non custodit. Alii autem dicebant: Quomodo potest homo peccator hæc signa facere? Et schisma erat inter eos.

verses.textEn: Therefore, they spoke again to the blind man, “What do you say about him who opened your eyes?” Then he said, “He is a Prophet.”
verses.textLa: Dicunt ergo cæco iterum: Tu quid dicis de illo, qui aperuit oculos tuos? Ille autem dixit: Quia Propheta est.

verses.textEn: Therefore, the Jews did not believe, about him, that he had been blind and had seen, until they called the parents of him who had seen.
verses.textLa: Non crediderunt ergo Iudæi de illo, quia cæcus fuisset et vidisset, donec vocaverunt parentes eius, qui viderat:

verses.textEn: And they questioned them, saying: “Is this your son, whom you say was born blind? Then how is it that he now sees?”
verses.textLa: et interrogaverunt eos, dicentes: Hic est filius vester, quem vos dicitis quia cæcus natus est? Quomodo ergo nunc videt?

verses.textEn: His parents responded to them and said: “We know that this is our son and that he was born blind.
verses.textLa: Responderunt eis parentes eius, et dixerunt: Scimus quia hic est filius noster, et quia cæcus natus est:

verses.textEn: But how it is that he now sees, we do not know. And who opened his eyes, we do not know. Ask him. He is old enough. Let him speak for himself.”
verses.textLa: quomodo autem nunc videat, nescimus: aut quis eius aperuit oculos, nos nescimus: ipsum interrogate: ætatem habet, ipse de se loquatur.

verses.textEn: His parents said these things because they were afraid of the Jews. For the Jews had already conspired, so that if anyone were to confess him to be the Christ, he would be expelled from the synagogue.
verses.textLa: Hæc dixerunt parentes eius, quoniam timebant Iudæos: iam enim conspiraverunt Iudæi, ut si quis eum confiteretur esse Christum, extra synagogam fieret.

verses.textEn: It was for this reason that his parents said: “He is old enough. Ask him.”
verses.textLa: Propterea parentes eius dixerunt: Quia ætatem habet, ipsum interrogate.

verses.textEn: Therefore, they again called the man who had been blind, and they said to him: “Give glory to God. We know that this man is a sinner.”
verses.textLa: Vocaverunt ergo rursum hominem, qui fuerat cæcus, et dixerunt ei: Da gloriam Deo. Nos scimus quia hic homo peccator est.

verses.textEn: And so he said to them: “If he is a sinner, I do not know it. One thing I do know, that although I was blind, now I see.”
verses.textLa: Dixit ergo eis ille: Si peccator est, nescio: unum scio, quia cæcus cum essem, modo video.

verses.textEn: Then they said to him: “What did he do to you? How did he open your eyes?”
verses.textLa: Dixerunt ergo illi: Quid fecit tibi? Quomodo aperuit tibi oculos?

verses.textEn: He answered them: “I have already told you, and you heard it. Why do you want to hear it again? Do you also want to become his disciples?”
verses.textLa: Respondit eis: Dixi vobis iam, et audistis: quod iterum vultis audire? Numquid et vos vultis discipuli eius fieri?

verses.textEn: Therefore, they cursed him and said: “You be his disciple. But we are disciples of Moses.
verses.textLa: Maledixerunt ergo ei, et dixerunt: Tu discipulus illius sis: nos autem Moysi discipuli sumus.

verses.textEn: We know that God spoke to Moses. But this man, we do not know where he is from.”
verses.textLa: Nos scimus quia Moysi locutus est Deus: hunc autem nescimus unde sit.

verses.textEn: The man responded and said to them: “Now in this is a wonder: that you do not know where he is from, and yet he has opened my eyes.
verses.textLa: Respondit ille homo, et dixit eis: In hoc enim mirabile est quia vos nescitis unde sit, et aperuit meos oculos:

verses.textEn: And we know that God does not hear sinners. But if anyone is a worshipper of God and does his will, then he heeds him.
verses.textLa: scimus autem quia peccatores Deus non audit: sed si quis Dei cultor est, et voluntatem eius facit, hunc exaudit.

verses.textEn: From ancient times, it has not been heard that anyone has opened the eyes of someone born blind.
verses.textLa: A sæculo non est auditum quia quis aperuit oculos cæci nati.

verses.textEn: Unless this man were of God, he would not be able to do any such thing.”
verses.textLa: Nisi esset hic a Deo, non poterat facere quidquam.

verses.textEn: They responded and said to him, “You were born entirely in sins, and you would teach us?” And they cast him out.
verses.textLa: Responderunt, et dixerunt ei: In peccatis natus es totus, et tu doces nos? Et eiecerunt eum foras.

verses.textEn: Jesus heard that they had cast him out. And when he had found him, he said to him, “Do you believe in the Son of God?”
verses.textLa: Audivit Iesus quia eiecerunt eum foras: et cum invenisset eum, dixit ei: Tu credis in Filium Dei?

verses.textEn: He responded and said, “Who is he, Lord, so that I may believe in him?”
verses.textLa: Respondit ille, et dixit: Quis est, Domine, ut credam in eum?

verses.textEn: And Jesus said to him, “You have both seen him, and he is the one who is speaking with you.”
verses.textLa: Et dixit ei Iesus: Et vidisti eum, et qui loquitur tecum, ipse est.

verses.textEn: And he said, “I believe, Lord.” And falling prostrate, he worshipped him.
verses.textLa: At ille ait: Credo Domine. Et procidens adoravit eum.

verses.textEn: And Jesus said, “I came into this world in judgment, so that those who do not see, may see; and so that those who see, may become blind.”
verses.textLa: Et dixit Iesus: In iudicium ego in hunc mundum veni: ut qui non vident videant, et qui vident cæci fiant.

verses.textEn: And certain Pharisees, who were with him, heard this, and they said to him, “Are we also blind?”
verses.textLa: Et audierunt quidam ex Pharisæis, qui cum ipso erant, et dixerunt ei: Numquid et nos cæci sumus?

verses.textEn: Jesus said to them: “If you were blind, you would not have sin. Yet now you say, ‘We see.’ So your sin persists.”
verses.textLa: Dixit eis Iesus: Si cæci essetis, non haberetis peccatum. Nunc vero dicitis: Quia videmus. Peccatum vestrum manet.

verses.textEn: “Amen, amen, I say to you, he who does not enter through the door into the fold of the sheep, but climbs up by another way, he is a thief and a robber.
verses.textLa: Amen, amen dico vobis: qui non intrat per ostium in ovile ovium, sed ascendit aliunde: ille fur est, et latro.
verses.notes: On one level of meaning, this verse refers to the Antichrist.

verses.textEn: But he who enters through the door is the shepherd of the sheep.
verses.textLa: Qui autem intrat per ostium, pastor est ovium.

verses.textEn: To him the doorkeeper opens, and the sheep hear his voice, and he calls his own sheep by name, and he leads them out.
verses.textLa: Huic ostiarius aperit, et oves vocem eius audiunt, et proprias ovas vocat nominatim, et educit eas.

verses.textEn: And when he has sent out his sheep, he goes before them, and the sheep follow him, because they know his voice.
verses.textLa: Et cum proprias oves emiserit, ante eas vadit: et oves illum sequuntur, quia sciunt vocem eius.

verses.textEn: But they do not follow a stranger; instead they flee from him, because they do not know the voice of strangers.”
verses.textLa: Alienum autem non sequuntur, sed fugiunt ab eo: quia non noverunt vocem alienorum.

verses.textEn: Jesus spoke this proverb to them. But they did not understand what he was saying to them.
verses.textLa: Hoc proverbium dixit eis Iesus. Illi autem non cognoverunt quid loqueretur eis.

verses.textEn: Therefore, Jesus spoke to them again: “Amen, amen, I say to you, that I am the door of the sheep.
verses.textLa: Dixit ergo eis iterum Iesus: Amen, amen dico vobis, quia ego sum ostium ovium.

verses.textEn: All others, as many as have come, are thieves and robbers, and the sheep did not listen to them.
verses.textLa: Omnes quotquot venerunt, fures sunt, et latrones, et non audierunt eos oves.

verses.textEn: I am the door. If anyone has entered through me, he will be saved. And he shall go in and go out, and he shall find pastures.
verses.textLa: Ego sum ostium. Per me si quis introierit, salvabitur: et ingredietur, et egredietur, et pascua inveniet.

verses.textEn: The thief does not come, except so that he may steal and slaughter and destroy. I have come so that they may have life, and have it more abundantly.
verses.textLa: Fur non venit nisi ut furetur, et mactet, et perdat. Ego veni ut vitam habeant, et abundantius habeant.

verses.textEn: I am the good Shepherd. The good Shepherd gives his life for his sheep.
verses.textLa: Ego sum pastor bonus. Bonus pastor animam suam dat pro ovibus suis.

verses.textEn: But the hired hand, and whoever is not a shepherd, to whom the sheep do not belong, he sees the wolf approaching, and he departs from the sheep and flees. And the wolf ravages and scatters the sheep.
verses.textLa: Mercenarius autem, et qui non est pastor, cuius non sunt oves propriæ, videt lupum venientem, et dimittit oves, et fugit: et lupus rapit, et dispergit oves:

verses.textEn: And the hired hand flees, because he is a hired hand and there is no concern for the sheep within him.
verses.textLa: mercenarius autem fugit, quia mercenarius est, et non pertinet ad eum de ovibus.

verses.textEn: I am the good Shepherd, and I know my own, and my own know me,
verses.textLa: Ego sum pastor bonus: et cognosco meas, et cognoscunt me meæ.

verses.textEn: just as the Father knows me, and I know the Father. And I lay down my life for my sheep.
verses.textLa: Sicut novit me Pater, et ego agnosco Patrem: et animam meam pono pro ovibus meis.
verses.notes: The verb in Latin is different here: the Father ‘novit’ the Christ, but the Christ ‘agnosco’ the Father, because the relationship between the Father, Son, and Spirit is asymmetrical. Also the verb used to say that Christ knows his sheep and his sheep know him is different from that used to refer to the Father-Son relationship, because the God-man relationship is fundamentally different from relationships within the Trinity.

verses.textEn: And I have other sheep that are not of this fold, and I must lead them. They shall hear my voice, and there shall be one sheepfold and one shepherd.
verses.textLa: Et alias oves habeo, quæ non sunt ex hoc ovili: et illas oportet me adducere, et vocem meam audient, et fiet unum ovile, et unus pastor.

verses.textEn: For this reason, the Father loves me: because I lay down my life, so that I may take it up again.
verses.textLa: Propterea me diligit Pater: quia ego pono animam meam, ut iterum sumam eam.

verses.textEn: No one takes it away from me. Instead, I lay it down of my own accord. And I have the power to lay it down. And I have the power to take it up again. This is the commandment that I have received from my Father.”
verses.textLa: Nemo tollit eam a me: sed ego pono eam a meipso, et potestatem habeo ponendi eam: et potestatem habeo iterum sumendi eam: Hoc mandatum accepi a Patre meo.

verses.textEn: A dissension occurred again among the Jews because of these words.
verses.textLa: Dissensio iterum facta est inter Iudæos propter sermones hos.

verses.textEn: Then many of them were saying: “He has a demon or he is insane. Why do you listen him?”
verses.textLa: Dicebant autem multi ex ipsis: Dæmonium habet, et insanit: quid eum auditis?

verses.textEn: Others were saying: “These are not the words of someone who has a demon. How would a demon be able to open the eyes of the blind?”
verses.textLa: Alii dicebant: Hæc verba non sunt dæmonium habentis: numquid dæmonium potest cæcorum oculos aperire?

verses.textEn: Now it was the Feast of the Dedication at Jerusalem, and it was winter.
verses.textLa: Facta sunt autem Encænia in Ierosolymis: et hiems erat.

verses.textEn: And Jesus was walking in the temple, in the portico of Solomon.
verses.textLa: Et ambulabat Iesus in templo, in porticu Salomonis.

verses.textEn: And so the Jews surrounded him and said to him: “How long will you hold our souls in suspense? If you are the Christ, tell us plainly.”
verses.textLa: Circumdederunt ergo eum Iudæi, et dicebant ei: Quousque animam nostram tollis? Si tu es Christus, dic nobis palam.

verses.textEn: Jesus answered them: “I speak to you, and you do not believe. The works that I do in the name of my Father, these offer testimony about me.
verses.textLa: Respondit eis Iesus: Loquor vobis, et non creditis. Opera, quæ ego facio in nomine Patris mei, hæc testimonium perhibent de me:

verses.textEn: But you do not believe, because you are not of my sheep.
verses.textLa: sed vos non creditis, quia non estis ex ovibus meis.

verses.textEn: My sheep hear my voice. And I know them, and they follow me.
verses.textLa: Oves meæ vocem meam audiunt: et ego cognosco eas, et sequuntur me:

verses.textEn: And I give them eternal life, and they shall not perish, for eternity. And no one shall seize them from my hand.
verses.textLa: et ego vitam æternam do eis: et non peribunt in æternum, et non rapiet eas quisquam de manu mea.

verses.textEn: What my Father gave to me is greater than all, and no one is able to seize from the hand of my Father.
verses.textLa: Pater meus quod dedit mihi, maius omnibus est: et nemo potest rapere de manu Patris mei.

verses.textEn: I and the Father are one.”
verses.textLa: Ego, et Pater unum sumus.

verses.textEn: Therefore, the Jews took up stones, in order to stone him.
verses.textLa: Sustulerunt ergo lapides Iudæi, ut lapidarent eum.

verses.textEn: Jesus answered them: “I have shown you many good works from my Father. For which of those works do you stone me?”
verses.textLa: Respondit eis Iesus: Multa bona opera ostendi vobis ex Patre meo, propter quod eorum opus me lapidatis?

verses.textEn: The Jews answered him: “We do not stone you for a good work, but for blasphemy and because, though you are a man, you make yourself God.”
verses.textLa: Responderunt ei Iudæi: De bono opere non lapidamus te, sed de blasphemia: et quia tu homo cum sis, facis teipsum Deum.

verses.textEn: Jesus responded to them: “Is it not written in your law, ‘I said: you are gods?’
verses.textLa: Respondit eis Iesus: Nonne scriptum est in lege vestra: quia Ego dixi, dii estis?

verses.textEn: If he called those to whom the word of God was given gods, and Scripture cannot be broken,
verses.textLa: Si illos dixit deos, ad quos sermo Dei factus est, et non potest solvi scriptura:

verses.textEn: why do you say, about him whom the Father has sanctified and sent into the world, ‘You have blasphemed,’ because I said, ‘I am the Son of God?’
verses.textLa: quem Pater sanctificavit, et misit in mundum, vos dicitis: Quia blasphemas: quia dixi, Filius Dei sum?

verses.textEn: If I do not do the works of my Father, do not believe in me.
verses.textLa: Si non facio opera Patris mei, nolite credere mihi.

verses.textEn: But if I do them, even if you are not willing to believe in me, believe the works, so that you may know and believe that the Father is in me, and I am in the Father.”
verses.textLa: Si autem facio: et si mihi non vultis credere, operibus credite, ut cognoscatis, et credatis quia Pater in me est, et ego in Patre.

verses.textEn: Therefore, they sought to apprehend him, but he escaped from their hands.
verses.textLa: Quærebant ergo eum apprehendere: et exivit de manibus eorum.

verses.textEn: And he went again across the Jordan, to that place where John first was baptizing. And he lodged there.
verses.textLa: Et abiit iterum trans Iordanem in eum locum, ubi erat Ioannes baptizans primum: et mansit illic:

verses.textEn: And many went out to him. And they were saying: “Indeed, John accomplished no signs.
verses.textLa: et multi venerunt ad eum, et dicebant: Quia Ioannes quidem signum fecit nullum.

verses.textEn: But all things whatsoever that John said about this man were true.” And many believed in him.
verses.textLa: Omnia autem quæcumque dixit Ioannes de hoc, vera erant. Et multi crediderunt in eum.

verses.textEn: Now there was a certain sick man, Lazarus of Bethania, from the town of Mary and her sister Martha.
verses.textLa: Erat autem quidem languens Lazarus a Bethania, de castello Mariæ, et Marthæ sororis eius.

verses.textEn: And Mary was the one who anointed the Lord with ointment and wiped his feet with her hair; her brother Lazarus was sick.
verses.textLa: (Maria autem erat, quæ unxit Dominum unguento, et extersit pedes eius capillis suis: cuius frater Lazarus infirmabatur.)

verses.textEn: Therefore, his sisters sent to him, saying: “Lord, behold, he whom you love is sick.”
verses.textLa: Miserunt ergo sorores eius ad eum dicentes: Domine, ecce quem amas infirmatur.

verses.textEn: Then, upon hearing this, Jesus said to them: “This sickness is not unto death, but for the glory of God, so that the Son of God may be glorified by it.”
verses.textLa: Audiens autem Iesus dixit eis: Infirmitas hæc non est ad mortem, sed pro gloria Dei, ut glorificetur Filius Dei per eam.

verses.textEn: Now Jesus loved Martha, and her sister Mary, and Lazarus.
verses.textLa: Diligebat autem Iesus Martham, et sororem eius Mariam, et Lazarum.

verses.textEn: Even so, after he heard that he was sick, he then still remained in the same place for two days.
verses.textLa: Ut ergo audivit quia infirmabatur, tunc quidem mansit in eodem loco duobus diebus.

verses.textEn: Then, after these things, he said to his disciples, “Let us go into Judea again.”
verses.textLa: Deinde post hæc dixit discipulis suis: Eamus in Iudæam iterum.

verses.textEn: The disciples said to him: “Rabbi, the Jews are even now seeking to stone you. And would you go there again?”
verses.textLa: Dicunt ei discipuli: Rabbi, nunc quærebant te Iudæi lapidare, et iterum vadis illuc?

verses.textEn: Jesus responded: “Are there not twelve hours in the day? If anyone walks in the daylight, he does not stumble, because he sees the light of this world.
verses.textLa: Respondit Iesus: Nonne duodecim sunt horæ diei? Si quis ambulaverit in die, non offendit, quia lucem huius mundi videt:

verses.textEn: But if he walks in the nighttime, he stumbles, because the light is not in him.”
verses.textLa: si autem ambulaverit in nocte, offendit, quia lux non est in eo.

verses.textEn: He said these things, and after this, he said to them: “Lazarus our friend is sleeping. But I am going, so that I may awaken him from sleep.”
verses.textLa: Hæc ait, et post hæc dixit eis: Lazarus amicus noster dormit: sed vado ut a somno excitem eum.

verses.textEn: And so his disciples said, “Lord, if he is sleeping, he shall be healthy.”
verses.textLa: Dixerunt ergo discipuli eius: Domine, si dormit, salvus erit.

verses.textEn: But Jesus had spoken about his death. Yet they thought that he spoke about the repose of sleep.
verses.textLa: Dixerat autem Iesus de morte eius: illi autem putaverunt quia de dormitione somni diceret.

verses.textEn: Therefore, Jesus then said to them plainly, “Lazarus has died.
verses.textLa: Tunc ergo Iesus dixit eis manifeste: Lazarus mortuus est:

verses.textEn: And I am glad for your sake that I was not there, so that you may believe. But let us go to him.”
verses.textLa: et gaudeo propter vos, ut credatis, quoniam non eram ibi. Sed eamus ad eum.

verses.textEn: And then Thomas, who is called the Twin, said to his fellow disciples, “Let us go, too, so that we may die with him.”
verses.textLa: Dixit ergo Thomas, qui dicitur Didymus, ad condiscipulos: Eamus et nos, ut moriamur cum eo.

verses.textEn: And so Jesus went. And he found that he had already been in the tomb for four days.
verses.textLa: Venit itaque Iesus: et invenit eum quattuor dies iam in monumento habentem.

verses.textEn: (Now Bethania was near Jerusalem, about fifteen stadia.)
verses.textLa: (Erat autem Bethania iuxta Ierosolymam quasi stadiis quindecim.)

verses.textEn: And many of the Jews had come to Martha and Mary, so as to console them over their brother.
verses.textLa: Multi autem ex Iudæis venerant ad Martham, et Mariam, ut consolarentur eas de fratre suo.

verses.textEn: Therefore, Martha, when she heard that Jesus was arriving, went out to meet him. But Mary was sitting at home.
verses.textLa: Martha ergo ut audivit quia Iesus venit, occurrit illi: Maria autem domi sedebat.

verses.textEn: And then Martha said to Jesus: “Lord, if you had been here, my brother would not have died.
verses.textLa: Dixit ergo Martha ad Iesum: Domine, si fuisses hic, frater meus non fuisset mortuus:

verses.textEn: But even now, I know that whatever you will request from God, God will give to you.”
verses.textLa: Sed et nunc scio quia quæcumque poposceris a Deo, dabit tibi Deus.

verses.textEn: Jesus said to her, “Your brother shall rise again.”
verses.textLa: Dicit illi Iesus: Resurget frater tuus.

verses.textEn: Martha said to him, “I know that he shall rise again, at the resurrection on the last day.”
verses.textLa: Dicit ei Martha: Scio quia resurget in resurrectione in novissimo die.

verses.textEn: Jesus said to her: “I am the Resurrection and the Life. Whoever believes in me, even though he has died, he shall live.
verses.textLa: Dixit ei Iesus: Ego sum resurrectio, et vita: qui credit in me, etiam si mortuus fuerit, vivet:

verses.textEn: And everyone who lives and believes in me shall not die for eternity. Do you believe this?”
verses.textLa: et omnis, qui vivit, et credit in me, non morietur in æternum. Credis hoc?

verses.textEn: She said to him: “Certainly, Lord. I have believed that you are the Christ, the Son of the living God, who has come into this world.”
verses.textLa: Ait illi: Utique Domine, ego credidi, quia tu es Christus Filius Dei vivi, qui in hunc mundum venisti.

verses.textEn: And when she had said these things, she went and called her sister Mary quietly, saying, “The Teacher is here, and he is calling you.”
verses.textLa: Et cum hæc dixisset, abiit, et vocavit Mariam sororem suam silentio, dicens: Magister adest, et vocat te.

verses.textEn: When she heard this, she rose up quickly and went to him.
verses.textLa: Illa ut audivit, surgit cito, et venit ad eum:

verses.textEn: For Jesus had not yet arrived in the town. But he was still at that place where Martha had met him.
verses.textLa: nondum enim venerat Iesus in castellum: sed erat adhuc in illo loco, ubi occurrerat ei Martha.

verses.textEn: Therefore, the Jews who were with her in the house and who were consoling her, when they had seen that Mary rose up quickly and went out, they followed her, saying, “She is going to the tomb, so that she may weep there.”
verses.textLa: Iudæi ergo, qui erant cum ea in domo, et consolabantur eam, cum vidissent Mariam quia cito surrexit, et exiit, secuti sunt eam dicentes: Quia vadit ad monumentum, ut ploret ibi.

verses.textEn: Therefore, when Mary had arrived to where Jesus was, seeing him, she fell down at his feet, and she said to him. “Lord, if you had been here, my brother would not have died.”
verses.textLa: Maria ergo, cum venisset ubi erat Iesus, videns eum, cecidit ad pedes eius, et dicit ei: Domine, si fuisses hic, non esset mortuus frater meus.

verses.textEn: And then, when Jesus saw her weeping, and the Jews who had arrived with her weeping, he groaned in spirit and became troubled.
verses.textLa: Iesus ergo, ut vidit eam plorantem, et Iudæos, qui venerant cum ea, plorantes, infremuit spiritu, et turbavit seipsum,
verses.notes: Here the phrase ‘turbavit seipsum,’ literally ‘he troubled himself,’ which is an active tense paired with a reflective pronoun, is translated with the passive tense, ‘he because troubled’.

verses.textEn: And he said, “Where have you laid him?” They said to him, “Lord, come and see.”
verses.textLa: et dixit: Ubi posuistis eum? Dicunt ei: Domine, veni, et vide.

verses.textEn: And Jesus wept.
verses.textLa: Et lacrymatus est Iesus.

verses.textEn: Therefore, the Jews said, “See how much he loved him!”
verses.textLa: Dixerunt ergo Iudæi: Ecce quomodo amabat eum.

verses.textEn: But some of them said, “Would not he who opened the eyes of one born blind have been able to cause this man not to die?”
verses.textLa: Quidam autem ex ipsis dixerunt: Non poterat hic, qui aperuit oculos cæci nati, facere ut hic non moreretur?

verses.textEn: Therefore, Jesus, again groaning from within himself, went to the tomb. Now it was a cave, and a stone had been placed over it.
verses.textLa: Iesus ergo rursum fremens in semetipso, venit ad monumentum. Erat autem spelunca: et lapis superpositus erat ei.

verses.textEn: Jesus said, “Take away the stone.” Martha, the sister of him who had died, said to him, “Lord, by now it will smell, for this is the fourth day.”
verses.textLa: Ait Iesus: Tollite lapidem. Dicit ei Martha soror eius, qui mortuus fuerat: Domine, iam fœtet, quatriduanus est enim.

verses.textEn: Jesus said to her, “Did I not say to you that if you believe, you shall see the glory of God?”
verses.textLa: Dicit ei Iesus: Nonne dixi tibi quoniam si credideris, videbis gloriam Dei?

verses.textEn: Therefore, they took away the stone. Then, lifting up his eyes, Jesus said: “Father, I give thanks to you because you have heard me.
verses.textLa: Tulerunt ergo lapidem: Iesus autem elevatis sursum oculis, dixit: Pater gratias ago tibi quoniam audisti me.

verses.textEn: And I know that you always hear me, but I have said this for the sake of the people who are standing nearby, so that they may believe that you have sent me.”
verses.textLa: Ego autem sciebam quia semper me audis, sed propter populum, qui circumstat, dixi: ut credant quia tu me misisti.

verses.textEn: When he had said these things, he cried in a loud voice, “Lazarus, come out.”
verses.textLa: Hæc cum dixisset, voce magna clamavit: Lazare veni foras.

verses.textEn: And immediately, he who had been dead went forth, bound at the feet and hands with winding bands. And his face was bound with a separate cloth. Jesus said to them, “Release him and let him go.”
verses.textLa: Et statim prodiit qui fuerat mortuus, ligatus pedes, et manus institis, et facies illius sudario erat ligata. Dixit eis Iesus: Solvite eum, et sinite abire.

verses.textEn: Therefore, many of the Jews, who had come to Mary and Martha, and who had seen the things that Jesus did, believed in him.
verses.textLa: Multi ergo ex Iudæis, qui venerant ad Mariam, et Martham, et viderant quæ fecit Iesus, crediderunt in eum.

verses.textEn: But certain ones among them went to the Pharisees and told them the things that Jesus had done.
verses.textLa: Quidam autem ex ipsis abierunt ad Pharisæos, et dixerunt eis quæ fecit Iesus.

verses.textEn: And so, the high priests and the Pharisees gathered a council, and they were saying: “What can we do? For this man accomplishes many signs.
verses.textLa: Collegerunt ergo Pontifices et Pharisæi concilium, et dicebant: Quid faciamus, quia hic homo multa signa facit?

verses.textEn: If we leave him alone, in this way all will believe in him. And then the Romans will come and take away our place and our nation.”
verses.textLa: Si dimittimus eum sic, omnes credent in eum: et venient Romani, et tollent nostrum locum, et gentem.

verses.textEn: Then one of them, named Caiaphas, since he was the high priest that year, said to them: “You do not understand anything.
verses.textLa: Unus autem ex ipsis Caiphas nomine, cum esset Pontifex anni illius, dixit eis: Vos nescitis quidquam,

verses.textEn: Nor do you realize that it is expedient for you that one man should die for the people, and that the entire nation should not perish.”
verses.textLa: nec cogitatis quia expedit vobis ut unus moriatur homo pro populo, et non tota gens pereat.

verses.textEn: Yet he did not say this from himself, but since he was the high priest that year, he prophesied that Jesus would die for the nation.
verses.textLa: Hoc autem a semetipso non dixit: sed cum esset Pontifex anni illius, prophetavit, quod Iesus moriturus erat pro gente,

verses.textEn: And not only for the nation, but in order to gather together as one the children of God who have been dispersed.
verses.textLa: et non tantum pro gente, sed ut filios Dei, qui erant dispersi, congregaret in unum.

verses.textEn: Therefore, from that day, they planned to put him to death.
verses.textLa: Ab illo ergo die cogitaverunt ut interficerent eum.

verses.textEn: And so, Jesus no longer walked in public with the Jews. But he went into a region near the desert, to a city which is called Ephraim. And he lodged there with his disciples.
verses.textLa: Iesus ergo iam non in palam ambulabat apud Iudæos, sed abiit in regionem iuxta desertum, in civitatem, quæ dicitur Ephrem, et ibi morabatur cum discipulis suis.

verses.textEn: Now the Passover of the Jews was near. And many from the countryside ascended to Jerusalem before the Passover, so that they might sanctify themselves.
verses.textLa: Proximum autem erat Pascha Iudæorum: et ascenderunt multi Ierosolymam de regione ante Pascha, ut sanctificarent se ipsos.

verses.textEn: Therefore, they were seeking Jesus. And they conferred with one another, while standing in the temple: “What do you think? Will he come to the feast day?”
verses.textLa: Quærebant ergo Iesum: et colloquebantur ad invicem, in templo stantes: Quid putatis, quia non venit ad diem festum?

verses.textEn: And the high priests and Pharisees had given an order, so that if anyone would know where he may be, he should reveal it, so that they might apprehend him.
verses.textLa: Dederant autem Pontifices, et Pharisæi mandatum, ut si quis cognoverit ubi sit, indicet, ut apprehendant eum.

verses.textEn: Then six days before the Passover, Jesus went to Bethania, where Lazarus had died, whom Jesus raised up.
verses.textLa: Iesus ergo ante sex dies Paschæ venit Bethaniam, ubi Lazarus fuerat mortuus, quem suscitavit Iesus.

verses.textEn: And they made a dinner for him there. And Martha was ministering. And truly, Lazarus was one of those who were sitting at table with him.
verses.textLa: Fecerunt autem ei cœnam ibi: et Martha ministrabat, Lazarus vero unus erat ex discumbentibus cum eo.

verses.textEn: And then Mary took twelve ounces of pure spikenard ointment, very precious, and she anointed the feet of Jesus, and she wiped his feet with her hair. And the house was filled with the fragrance of the ointment.
verses.textLa: Maria ergo accepit libram unguenti nardi pistici, pretiosi, et unxit pedes Iesu, et extersit pedes eius capillis suis: et domus impleta est ex odore unguenti.

verses.textEn: Then one of his disciples, Judas Iscariot, who was soon to betray him, said,
verses.textLa: Dixit ergo unus ex discipulis eius, Iudas Iscariotes, qui erat eum traditurus:

verses.textEn: “Why was this ointment not sold for three hundred denarii and given to the needy?”
verses.textLa: Quare hoc unguentum non væniit trecentis denariis, et datum est egenis?

verses.textEn: Now he said this, not out of concern for the needy, but because he was a thief and, since he held the purse, he used to carry what was put into it.
verses.textLa: Dixit autem hoc, non quia de egenis pertinebat ad eum, sed quia fur erat, et loculos habens, ea, quæ mittebantur, portabat.

verses.textEn: But Jesus said: “Permit her, so that she may keep it against the day of my burial.
verses.textLa: Dixit ergo Iesus: Sinite illam ut in diem sepulturæ meæ servet illud.

verses.textEn: For the poor, you have with you always. But me, you do always not have.”
verses.textLa: Pauperes enim semper habetis vobiscum: me autem non semper habetis.

verses.textEn: Now a great multitude of the Jews knew that he was in that place, and so they came, not so much because of Jesus, but so that they might see Lazarus, whom he had raised from the dead.
verses.textLa: Cognovit ergo turba multa ex Iudæis quia illic est: et venerunt, non propter Iesum tantum, sed ut Lazarum viderent, quem suscitavit a mortuis.

verses.textEn: And the leaders of the priests planned to put Lazarus to death also.
verses.textLa: Cogitaverunt autem principes sacerdotum ut et Lazarum interficerent:
verses.notes: The phrase ‘principes sacerdotum’ means ‘chief priests’ or ‘leaders of the priests.’ Whereas, the word ‘Pontifices’ refers to the high priests.

verses.textEn: For many of the Jews, because of him, were going away and were believing in Jesus.
verses.textLa: quia multi propter illum abibant ex Iudæis, et credebant in Iesum.

verses.textEn: Then, on the next day, the great crowd that had come to the feast day, when they had heard that Jesus was coming to Jerusalem,
verses.textLa: In crastinum autem turba multa, quæ venerat ad diem festum, cum audissent quia venit Iesus Ierosolymam:

verses.textEn: took branches of palm trees, and they went ahead to meet him. And they were crying out: “Hosanna! Blessed is he who arrives in the name of the Lord, the king of Israel!”
verses.textLa: acceperunt ramos palmarum, et processerunt obviam ei, et clamabant: Hosanna! Benedictus, qui venit in nomine Domini, Rex Israel!

verses.textEn: And Jesus found a small donkey, and he sat upon it, just as it is written:
verses.textLa: Et invenit Iesus asellum, et sedit super eum, sicut scriptum est:

verses.textEn: “Do not be afraid, daughter of Zion. Behold, your king arrives, sitting on the colt of a donkey.”
verses.textLa: Noli timere filia Sion: ecce Rex tuus venit sedens super pullum asinæ.

verses.textEn: At first, his disciples did not realize these things. But when Jesus was glorified, then they remembered that these things were written about him, and that these things happened to him.
verses.textLa: Hæc non cognoverunt discipuli eius primum: sed quando glorificatus est Iesus, tunc recordati sunt quia hæc erant scripta de eo: et hæc fecerunt ei.

verses.textEn: And so the crowd that had been with him, when he called Lazarus from the tomb and raised him from the dead, offered testimony.
verses.textLa: Testimonium ergo perhibebat turba, quæ erat cum eo quando Lazarum vocavit de monumento, et suscitavit eum a mortuis.

verses.textEn: Because of this, too, the crowd went out to meet him. For they heard that he had accomplished this sign.
verses.textLa: Propterea et obviam venit ei turba: quia audierunt fecisse hoc signum.

verses.textEn: Therefore, the Pharisees said among themselves: “Do you see that we are accomplishing nothing? Behold, the entire world has gone after him.”
verses.textLa: Pharisæi ergo dixerunt ad semetipsos: Videtis quia nihil proficimus? Ecce mundus totus post eum abiit.

verses.textEn: Now there were certain Gentiles among those who went up so that they might worship on the feast day.
verses.textLa: Erant autem quidam Gentiles ex his, qui ascenderant ut adorarent in die festo.

verses.textEn: Therefore, these approached Philip, who was from Bethsaida of Galilee, and they petitioned him, saying: “Sir, we want to see Jesus.”
verses.textLa: Hi ergo accesserunt ad Philippum, qui erat a Bethsaida Galilææ, et rogabant eum, dicentes: Domine, volumus Iesum videre.

verses.textEn: Philip went and told Andrew. Next, Andrew and Philip told Jesus.
verses.textLa: Venit Philippus, et dicit Andreæ: Andreas rursum, et Philippus dixerunt Iesu.

verses.textEn: But Jesus answered them by saying: “The hour arrives when the Son of man shall be glorified.
verses.textLa: Iesus autem respondit eis, dicens: Venit hora, ut clarificetur Filius hominis.

verses.textEn: Amen, amen, I say to you, unless the grain of wheat falls to the ground and dies,
verses.textLa: Amen, amen dico vobis, nisi granum frumenti cadens in terram, mortuum fuerit;

verses.textEn: it remains alone. But if it dies, it yields much fruit. Whoever loves his life, will lose it. And whoever hates his life in this world, preserves it unto eternal life.
verses.textLa: ipsum solum manet. Si autem mortuum fuerit, multum fructum affert. Qui amat animam suam, perdet eam: et qui odit animam suam in hoc mundo, in vitam æternam custodit eam.

verses.textEn: If anyone serves me, let him follow me. And where I am, there too my minister shall be. If anyone has served me, my Father will honor him.
verses.textLa: Si quis mihi ministrat, me sequatur: et ubi sum ego, illic et minister meus erit. Si quis mihi ministraverit, honorificabit eum Pater meus.

verses.textEn: Now my soul is troubled. And what should I say? Father, save me from this hour? But it is for this reason that I came to this hour.
verses.textLa: Nunc anima mea turbata est. Et quid dicam? Pater, salvifica me ex hac hora? Sed propterea veni in horam hanc.

verses.textEn: Father, glorify your name!” And then a voice came from heaven, “I have glorified it, and I will glorify it again.”
verses.textLa: Pater, clarifica nomen tuum. Venit ergo vox de cælo: Et clarificavi, et iterum clarificabo.

verses.textEn: Therefore, the crowd, which was standing near and had heard it, said that it was like thunder. Others were saying, “An Angel was speaking with him.”
verses.textLa: Turba ergo, quæ stabat, et audierat, dicebat tonitruum esse factum. Alii dicebant: Angelus ei locutus est.

verses.textEn: Jesus responded and said: “This voice came, not for my sake, but for your sakes.
verses.textLa: Respondit Iesus, et dixit: Non propter me hæc vox venit, sed propter vos.

verses.textEn: Now is the judgment of the world. Now will the prince of this world be cast out.
verses.textLa: Nunc iudicium est mundi: nunc princeps huius mundi eiicietur foras.

verses.textEn: And when I have been lifted up from the earth, I will draw all things to myself.”
verses.textLa: Et ego si exaltatus fuero a terra, omnia traham ad me ipsum.

verses.textEn: (Now he said this, signifying what kind of death he would die.)
verses.textLa: (hoc autem dicebat, significans qua morte esset moriturus.)

verses.textEn: The crowd answered him: “We have heard, from the law, that the Christ remains forever. And so how can you say, ‘The Son of man must be lifted up?’ Who is this Son of man?”
verses.textLa: Respondit ei turba: Nos audivimus ex lege, quia Christus manet in æternum: et quomodo tu dicis, Oportet exaltari Filium hominis? Quis est iste Filius hominis?

verses.textEn: Therefore, Jesus said to them: “For a brief time, the Light is among you. Walk while you have the Light, so that the darkness may not overtake you. But whoever walks in darkness does not know where is he going.
verses.textLa: Dixit ergo eis Iesus: Adhuc modicum, lumen in vobis est. Ambulate dum lucem habetis, ut non vos tenebræ comprehendant: et qui ambulant in tenebris, nescit quo vadat.

verses.textEn: While you have the Light, believe in the Light, so that you may be sons of the Light.” Jesus spoke these things, and then he went away and hid himself from them.
verses.textLa: Dum lucem habetis, credite in lucem, ut filii lucis sitis. Hæc locutus est Iesus: et abiit, et abscondit se ab eis.

verses.textEn: And although he had done such great signs in their presence, they did not believe in him,
verses.textLa: Cum autem tanta signa fecisset coram eis, non credebant in eum:

verses.textEn: so that the word of the prophet Isaiah might be fulfilled, which says: “Lord, who has believed in our hearing? And to whom has the arm of the Lord been revealed?”
verses.textLa: ut sermo Isaiæ prophetæ impleretur, quem dixit: Domine, quis credidit auditui nostro? Et brachium Domini cui revelatum est?

verses.textEn: Because of this, they were not able to believe, for Isaiah said again:
verses.textLa: Propterea non poterant credere, quia iterum dixit Isaias:

verses.textEn: “He has blinded their eyes, and hardened their heart, so that they may not see with their eyes, and understand with their heart, and be converted: and then I would heal them.”
verses.textLa: Excæcavit oculos eorum, et induravit cor eorum: ut non videant oculis, et non intelligant corde, et convertantur, et sanem eos.

verses.textEn: These things Isaiah said, when he saw his glory and was speaking about him.
verses.textLa: Hæc dixit Isaias, quando vidit gloriam eius, et locutus est de eo.

verses.textEn: Yet truly, many of the leaders also believed in him. But because of the Pharisees, they did not confess him, so that they would not be cast out of the synagogue.
verses.textLa: Verumtamen et ex principibus multi crediderunt in eum: sed propter Pharisæos non confitebantur, ut e synagoga non eiicerentur.

verses.textEn: For they loved the glory of men more than the glory of God.
verses.textLa: Dilexerunt enim gloriam hominum magis, quam gloriam Dei.

verses.textEn: But Jesus cried out and said: “Whoever believes in me, does not believe in me, but in him who sent me.
verses.textLa: Iesus autem clamavit, et dixit: Qui credit in me, non credit in me, sed in eum, qui misit me.

verses.textEn: And whoever sees me, sees him who sent me.
verses.textLa: Et qui videt me, videt eum, qui misit me.

verses.textEn: I have arrived as a light to the world, so that all who believe in me might not remain in darkness.
verses.textLa: Ego lux in mundum veni: ut omnis, qui credit in me, in tenebris non maneat.

verses.textEn: And if anyone has heard my words and not kept them, I do not judge him. For I did not come so that I may judge the world, but so that I may save the world.
verses.textLa: Et si quis audierit verba mea, et non custodierit: ego non iudico eum. Non enim veni ut iudicem mundum, sed ut salvificem mundum.

verses.textEn: Whoever despises me and does not accept my words has one who judges him. The word that I have spoken, the same shall judge him on the last day.
verses.textLa: Qui spernit me, et non accipit verba mea: habet qui iudicet eum. Sermo, quem locutus sum, ille iudicabit eum in novissimo die.

verses.textEn: For I am not speaking from myself, but from the Father who sent me. He gave a commandment to me as to what I should say and how I should speak.
verses.textLa: Quia ego ex me ipso non sum locutus, sed qui misit me Pater, ipse mihi mandatum dedit quid dicam, et quid loquar.

verses.textEn: And I know that his commandment is eternal life. Therefore, the things that I speak, just as the Father has said to me, so also do I speak.”
verses.textLa: Et scio quia mandatum eius vita æterna est. Quæ ergo ego loquor, sicut dixit mihi Pater, sic loquor.

verses.textEn: Before the feast day of the Passover, Jesus knew that the hour was approaching when he would pass from this world to the Father. And since he had always loved his own who were in the world, he loved them unto the end.
verses.textLa: Ante diem festum Paschæ, sciens Iesus quia venit hora eius ut transeat ex hoc mundo ad Patrem: cum dilexisset suos, qui erant in mundo, in finem dilexit eos.

verses.textEn: And when the meal had taken place, when the devil had now put it into the heart of Judas Iscariot, the son of Simon, to betray him,
verses.textLa: Et cœna facta, cum diabolus iam misisset in cor ut traderet eum Iudas Simonis Iscariotæ:

verses.textEn: knowing that the Father had given all things into his hands and that he came from God and was going to God,
verses.textLa: sciens quia omnia dedit ei Pater in manus, et quia a Deo exivit, et ad Deum vadit:

verses.textEn: he rose up from the meal, and he set aside his vestments, and when he had received a towel, he wrapped it around himself.
verses.textLa: surgit a cœna, et ponit vestimenta sua: et cum accepisset linteum, præcinxit se.

verses.textEn: Next he put water into a shallow bowl, and he began to wash the feet of the disciples and to wipe them with the towel with which he was wrapped.
verses.textLa: Deinde mittit aquam in pelvim, et cœpit lavare pedes discipulorum, et extergere linteo, quo erat præcinctus.

verses.textEn: And then he came to Simon Peter. And Peter said to him, “Lord, would you wash my feet?”
verses.textLa: Venit ergo ad Simonem Petrum. Et dicit ei Petrus: Domine, tu mihi lavas pedes?

verses.textEn: Jesus responded and said to him: “What I am doing, you do not now understand. But you shall understand it afterward.”
verses.textLa: Respondit Iesus, et dixit ei: Quod ego facio, tu nescis modo, scies autem postea.

verses.textEn: Peter said to him, “You shall never wash my feet!” Jesus answered him, “If I do not wash you, you will have no place with me.”
verses.textLa: Dicit ei Petrus: Non lavabis mihi pedes in æternum. Respondit ei Iesus: Si non lavero te, non habebis partem mecum.

verses.textEn: Simon Peter said to him, “Then Lord, not only my feet, but also my hands and my head!”
verses.textLa: Dicit ei Simon Petrus: Domine, non tantum pedes meos, sed et manus, et caput.

verses.textEn: Jesus said to him: “He who is washed need only wash his feet, and then he will be entirely clean. And you are clean, but not all.”
verses.textLa: Dicit ei Iesus: Qui lotus est, non indiget nisi ut pedes lavet, sed est mundus totus. Et vos mundi estis, sed non omnes.
verses.notes: When Peter is washed at his head, his whole body is clean. Therefore, when a man become the Roman Pontiff, i.e. the successor of Peter, he cannot possibly fall into heresy. For he is necessarily prevented from this failing: his head has been washed by taking the office of Pope, so his whole self is clean from heresy and schism.

verses.textEn: For he knew which one would betray him. For this reason, he said, “You are not all clean.”
verses.textLa: Sciebat enim quisnam esset qui traderet eum: propterea dixit: Non estis mundi omnes.

verses.textEn: And so, after he washed their feet and received his vestments, when he had sat down at table again, he said to them: “Do you know what I have done for you?
verses.textLa: Postquam ergo lavit pedes eorum, et accepit vestimenta sua: cum recubuisset iterum dixit eis: Scitis quid fecerim vobis?

verses.textEn: You call me Teacher and Lord, and you speak well: for so I am.
verses.textLa: Vos vocatis me Magister, et Domine, et bene dicitis: sum etenim.

verses.textEn: Therefore, if I, your Lord and Teacher, have washed your feet, you also ought to wash the feet of one another.
verses.textLa: Si ergo ego lavi pedes vestros, Dominus, et Magister: et vos debetis alter alterius lavare pedes.

verses.textEn: For I have given you an example, so that just as I have done for you, so also should you do.
verses.textLa: Exemplum enim dedi vobis, ut quemadmodum ego feci vobis, ita et vos faciatis.

verses.textEn: Amen, amen, I say to you, the servant is not greater than his Lord, and the apostle is not greater than he who sent him.
verses.textLa: Amen, amen dico vobis: non est servus maior Domino suo: neque apostolus maior est eo, qui misit illum.

verses.textEn: If you understand this, you shall be blessed if you will do it.
verses.textLa: Si hæc scitis, beati eritis si feceritis ea.

verses.textEn: I am not speaking about all of you. I know those whom I have chosen. But this is so that the Scripture may be fulfilled, ‘He who eats bread with me shall lift up his heel against me.’
verses.textLa: Non de omnibus vobis dico: ego scio quos elegerim: sed ut adimpleatur Scriptura: Qui manducat mecum panem, levabit contra me calcaneum suum.

verses.textEn: And I tell you this now, before it happens, so that when it has happened, you may believe that I am.
verses.textLa: Amodo dico vobis, priusquam fiat: ut cum factum fuerit, credatis, quia ego sum.

verses.textEn: Amen, amen, I say to you, whoever receives anyone whom I send, receives me. And whoever receives me, receives him who sent me.”
verses.textLa: Amen, amen dico vobis: Qui accipit si quem misero, me accipit: qui autem me accipit, accipit eum, qui me misit.

verses.textEn: When Jesus had said these things, he was troubled in spirit. And he bore witness by saying: “Amen, amen, I say to you, that one among you shall betray me.”
verses.textLa: Cum hæc dixisset Iesus, turbatus est spiritu: et protestatus est, et dixit: Amen, amen dico vobis: Quia unus ex vobis tradet me.

verses.textEn: Therefore, the disciples looked around at one another, uncertain about whom he spoke.
verses.textLa: Aspiciebant ergo ad invicem discipuli, hæsitantes de quo diceret.

verses.textEn: And leaning against the bosom of Jesus was one of his disciples, the one whom Jesus loved.
verses.textLa: Erat ergo recumbens unus ex discipulis eius in sinu Iesu, quem diligebat Iesus.

verses.textEn: Therefore, Simon Peter motioned to this one and said to him, “Who is it that he is speaking about?”
verses.textLa: Innuit ergo huic Simon Petrus: et dixit ei: Quis est, de quo dicit?

verses.textEn: And so, leaning against the chest of Jesus, he said to him, “Lord, who is it?”
verses.textLa: Itaque cum recubuisset ille supra pectus Iesu, dicit ei: Domine quis est?

verses.textEn: Jesus responded, “It is he to whom I shall extend the dipped bread.” And when he had dipped the bread, he gave it to Judas Iscariot, son of Simon.
verses.textLa: Respondit Iesus: Ille est, cui ego intinctum panem porrexero. Et cum intinxisset panem, dedit Iudæ Simonis Iscariotæ.

verses.textEn: And after the morsel, Satan entered into him. And Jesus said to him, “What you are going to do, do quickly.”
verses.textLa: Et post buccellam, introivit in eum Satanas. Et dixit ei Iesus: Quod facis, fac citius.

verses.textEn: Now none of those sitting at table knew why he had said this to him.
verses.textLa: Hoc autem nemo scivit discumbentium ad quid dixerit ei.

verses.textEn: For some were thinking that, because Judas held the purse, that Jesus had told him, “Buy those things which are needed by us for the feast day,” or that he might give something to the needy.
verses.textLa: Quidam enim putabant, quia loculos habebat Iudas, quod dixisset ei Iesus: Eme ea, quæ opus sunt nobis ad diem festum: aut egenis ut aliquid daret.
verses.notes: But they could not have bought anything if this was the regular time for the Passover meal, after sunset on Friday, Nisan 14, because then the Sabbath would begin. Therefore, this Passover meal was held on Thursday, Nisan 13, a day before most Jews would celebrate the Passover. This was permitted to the Jews from Galilee, as Blessed A. C. Emmerich explains.

verses.textEn: Therefore, having accepted the morsel, he went out immediately. And it was night.
verses.textLa: Cum ergo accepisset ille buccellam, exivit continuo. Erat autem nox.

verses.textEn: Then, when he had gone out, Jesus said: “Now the Son of man has been glorified, and God has been glorified in him.
verses.textLa: Cum ergo exisset, dixit Iesus: Nunc clarificatus est Filius hominis: et Deus clarificatus est in eo.

verses.textEn: If God has been glorified in him, then God will also glorify him in himself, and he will glorify him without delay.
verses.textLa: Si Deus clarificatus est in eo, et Deus clarificabit eum in semetipso: et continuo clarificabit eum.

verses.textEn: Little sons, for a brief while, I am with you. You shall seek me, and just as I said to the Jews, ‘Where I am going, you are not able to go,’ so also I say to you now.
verses.textLa: Filioli, adhuc modicum vobiscum sum. Quæretis me: et sicut dixi Iudæis: Quo ego vado, vos non potestis venire: et vobis dico modo.

verses.textEn: I give you a new commandment: Love one another. Just as I have loved you, so also must you love one another.
verses.textLa: Mandatum novum do vobis: Ut diligatis invicem, sicut dilexi vos, ut et vos diligatis invicem.

verses.textEn: By this, all shall recognize that you are my disciples: if you will have love for one another.”
verses.textLa: In hoc cognoscent omnes quia discipuli mei estis, si dilectionem habueritis ad invicem.

verses.textEn: Simon Peter said to him, “Lord, where are you going?” Jesus responded: “Where I am going, you are not able to follow me now. But you shall follow afterward.”
verses.textLa: Dicit ei Simon Petrus: Domine, quo vadis? Respondit Iesus: Quo ego vado, non potes me modo sequi: sequeris autem postea.

verses.textEn: Peter said to him: “Why am I unable to follow you now? I will lay down my life for you!”
verses.textLa: Dicit ei Petrus: Quare non possum te sequi modo? Animam meam pro te ponam.

verses.textEn: Jesus answered him: “You will lay down your life for me? Amen, amen, I say to you, the rooster will not crow, until you deny me three times.”
verses.textLa: Respondit ei Iesus: Animam tuam pro me pones? Amen, amen dico tibi: non cantabit gallus, donec ter me neges.

verses.textEn: “Do not let your heart be troubled. You believe in God. Believe in me also.
verses.textLa: Non turbetur cor vestrum. Creditis in Deum, et in me credite.

verses.textEn: In my Father’s house, there are many dwelling places. If there were not, I would have told you. For I go to prepare a place for you.
verses.textLa: In domo Patris mei mansiones multæ sunt. Si quo minus dixissem vobis: Quia vado parare vobis locum.
verses.notes: Some translations render ‘mansiones’ as ‘mansions.’ But a translator should not always use the English word that most closely resembles the Latin word. In this case, ‘mansions’ is not accurate and ‘rooms’ can be used only metaphorically, so ‘dwelling places’ is a better fit, being more general and a more accurate rendering of ‘mansiones.’

verses.textEn: And if I go and prepare a place for you, I will return again, and then I will take you to myself, so that where I am, you also may be.
verses.textLa: Et si abiero, et præparavero vobis locum: iterum venio, et accipiam vos ad meipsum, ut ubi sum ego, et vos sitis.

verses.textEn: And you know where I am going. And you know the way.”
verses.textLa: Et quo ego vado scitis, et viam scitis.

verses.textEn: Thomas said to him, “Lord, we do not know where you are going, so how can we know the way?”
verses.textLa: Dicit ei Thomas: Domine, nescimus quo vadis: et quo modo possumus viam scire?

verses.textEn: Jesus said to him: “I am the Way, and the Truth, and the Life. No one comes to the Father, except through me.
verses.textLa: Dicit ei Iesus: Ego sum via, et veritas, et vita. Nemo venit ad Patrem, nisi per me.

verses.textEn: If you had known me, certainly you would also have known my Father. And from now on, you shall know him, and you have seen him.”
